articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: U.S. Federal Reserve officials, who have tentatively embraced the possibility they can squelch inflation without a recession, meet this week with an autoworkers strike, a possible federal government shutdown, and a student loan squeeze on consumers posing new risks to that best-case outcome.
articles.title: The Fed wants to cool spending; a strike, a shutdown and student loans may add ice

articles.author: Steve Scherer
articles.description: More than a year after Canada first announced incentives to jumpstart clean technology projects there is still no money flowing, and if they are not in place soon, more than C$50 billion ($37 billion) in investments could be at risk, industry groups said.
articles.title: Canada risks more than C$50 billion in clean tech as incentives in limbo

articles.author: Yu Xie
articles.description: Embattled Chinese property developer Country Garden (2007.HK) faces yet another liquidity test with Monday's deadline to pay $15 million in interest linked to an offshore bond, after having dodged default at the last minute twice this month.
articles.title: China's cash-squeezed Country Garden faces another dollar coupon deadline

articles.author: Chandni Shah
articles.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan asked Tesla (TSLA.O) CEO Elon Musk to build a Tesla factory in Turkey, Anadolu Agency posted on social media platform X on Sunday.
articles.title: Erdogan asks Musk to build Tesla factory in Turkey

articles.author: Mathieu Rosemain
articles.description: Societe Generale (SOGN.PA) shares dropped more than 6% in early Monday trade after France's third-biggest bank said it expected little if any growth in annual sales over the coming years in a keenly-awaited strategic plan from its new CEO.
articles.title: SocGen shares drop after new strategy flags little growth

articles.author: Toby Sterling, Tannur Anders
articles.description: Bob van Dijk has stepped down as the long-time CEO of Dutch technology investor Prosus (PRX.AS) and its South African parent company Naspers, with M&A chief Ervin Tu taking both positions on an interim basis.
articles.title: Naspers/Prosus CEO steps down, M&A chief Tu takes the helm

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Marketing automation company Klaviyo on Monday increased the proposed price range for its initial pubic offering (IPO) due this week, targeting a fully diluted valuation of up to $9 billion.
articles.title: Marketing firm Klaviyo lifts IPO price range, targets $9 bln valuation

articles.author: Andrew Mills
articles.description: A Qatari plane waited in Iran on Monday to fly out five U.S. detainees in a swap for five Iranians held in the United States, thanks to a Doha-mediated deal that has also unfrozen $6 billion of Iranian funds.
articles.title: US and Iran to swap detainees after $6 billion unfrozen

articles.author: Belén Carreño
articles.description: The European Union could become as dependent on China for lithium-ion batteries and fuel cells by 2030 as it was on Russia for energy before the war in Ukraine unless it takes strong measures, a paper prepared for EU leaders said.
articles.title: Exclusive: EU may become as hooked on China batteries as it was on Russian energy

articles.author: Greg Torode, Yew Lun Tian
articles.description: The disappearance of Chinese Defence Minister Li Shangfu highlights the opaque and complex nature of the People's Liberation Army (PLA), diplomats and analysts say.
articles.title: China's military hierarchy under spotlight after defence minister disappears
